snippet: Mr. South was a singer-songwriter who wove confrontational lyrics into bouncy pop hits of the late 1960s and early ’70s, including “Games People Play” and “(I Never Promised You a) Rose Garden.”
abstract: Joe South, a singer-songwriter who wove confrontational lyrics into bouncy pop hits of the late 1960s and early ’70s, dies at age 72.
lead_paragraph: Mr. South was a singer-songwriter who wove confrontational lyrics into bouncy pop hits of the late 1960s and early ’70s, including “Games People Play” and “(I Never Promised You a) Rose Garden.”

headline.seo: Joe South, Singer and Songwriter, Dies at 72
headline.main: Joe South, Singer and Writer of Hit Songs, Dies at 72
headline.print_headline: Joe South, 72, a Singer And Writer of Hit Songs
